block.p: LEAD: * AMR Corp., Fort Worth, will acquire Wings West Airlines Inc. for $10.50 a share, or about $41.7 million.
LEAD: * AMR Corp., Fort Worth, will acquire Wings West Airlines Inc. for $10.50 a share, or about $41.7 million.
* AMR Corp., Fort Worth, will acquire Wings West Airlines Inc. for $10.50 a share, or about $41.7 million.
* British Shipbuilders, the British Government-owned concern, said Kvaerner Industries of Norway is interested in buying the Govan shipyards.
* Cadbury Schweppes P.L.C., London, announced a joint venture with Coca-Cola Co. to build a new bottling and canning plant in the Yorkshire region for about $94.5 million.

* Control Data Corp., Minneapolis, introduced six new Cyber minicomputers with increased speed and memory, aiming the products at a market segment dominated by I.B.M. Corp. and Digital Equipment Corp.
* Ford Motor Co., Dearborn, Mich., increased the price of the Ford Festiva by 1.6 percent and of the Mercury Tracer by 1.3 percent. Both models are imported.
* Grow Group Inc. said it would sell its Perrigo Co. unit to S&J Acquisition Corp., a new company owned by Perrigo's management, for $61 million.
* Interstate Theater Corp., Boston, a cinema chain, was acquired by the Australian cinema operator Hoyts Groups Ltd. for an undisclosed price.
* Leslie Fay Cos., a maker of women's dresses, suits, blouses and sportswear, completed the acquisition of the business of Albert Nipon Inc., a maker of women's designer clothing.

* S. H. Holdings Inc., Washington, which is set to acquire Jewelcor Inc. at $19 a share, said it had made a preliminary decision to sell Jewlcor's graphic arts segment and real estate connected with some of its catalogue showrooms after the buyout. S. H. Holdings is a group that includes some of Jewelcor's management.
Correction: April 21, 1988, Thursday, Late City Final Edition
Correction: April 21, 1988, Thursday, Late City Final Edition
